node.background: In a bid to reduce prescription drug costs, Colorado state health officials are developing what would be one of the nation’s first drug importation programs. But the state can’t do it alone. Under a 2003 law authorizing the practice, federal approval is required to import drugs from abroad -- and to date no state has ever received it. President Donald Trump supports doing do, but even if the state received the go-ahead by the end of 2020, the next administration would still play a role in such a program’s implementation. One major hurdle that could demand the next president’s attention: Canadian officials have concerns about the idea, and could unilaterally block drug exports to the U.S. before such a program can get off the ground.
node.longAnswer: Joe Biden long answer about drug-import
node.questionText: Do you support giving states the ability to import prescription drugs from other countries?
node.shortAnswer: Joe Biden short answer about drug-import
